questions.question: The Manifold Pressure Gauge fitted to a supercharged engine measures:

options.content: the absolute pressure in the induction manifold
the differential pressure across the supercharger compressor
the ratio between the atmospheric pressure and the cam rise at the supercharger inlet
the pressure upstream of the throttle valve

questions.question: An Automatic Boost Control Unit:

options.content: prevents detonation and dissociation in the cylinder
maintains an automatic preset boost press
maintains the correct mixture strength for the boost pressure set
sets the position of the wastegate to ensure the preset boost is maintained

questions.question: The use of a turbocharger on an engine will:

options.content: raise the volumetric efficiency of the engine
cause an automatic rise in the engine rpm as altitude is gained
cause an automatic rise in engine power as altitude is gained

questions.question: The motive force used to drive the turbocharger is:

options.content: torque from the crankshaft via a spring drive unit
energy from the exhaust that would otherwise have been wasted

questions.question: The power increase that occurs with initial increase in altitude when an engine has an internal supercharger fitted, is due to:

options.content: the reduced weight of mixture being passed to the engine
the decreasing density of the atmosphere

questions.question: Rated Altitude is:

options.content: the height at which the boost pressure ceases to be effective with a specific rpm set
a comparison between the boost pressure at sea level and that at a given altitude
the maximum altitude at which Rated Boost can be maintained with Rated rpm set
the altitude at which the wastegate becomes fully shut

questions.question: The speed of the turbine of a turbocharger is controlled by:

options.content: controlling the exit of the exhaust gas passing out of the eye of the impeller
the use of a variable controller
an automatic gearbox positioned between the turbine and the impeller

questions.question: The turbocharger wastegate is spring loaded towards:

options.content: a neutrally balanced partly open position

questions.question: The turbocharger bearing is lubricated and cooled by:

options.content: its own internal self-contained oil system
a tapping in the scavenge oil system

questions.question: Static Boost is:

options.content: always the ISA atmospheric pressure for the airfield altit
obtained by opening the throttle to give a boost gauge reading of 30 in Hg or 0 psi.
the boost pressure gauge reading when the engine is not running. Selecting a suitable throttle position will give the same boost gauge reading when the engine is running
the difference between the induction manifold pressure and the exhaust manifold pressure

questions.question: The automatic boost pressure control capsules are made sensitive to:
In order to maintain a constant boost pressure with increasing altitude, the ABC:

options.content: holds the throttle valve at a constant position

questions.question: “Boost pressure” is the:

options.content: inlet manifold pressure in pounds per square inch above or below standard mean sea level pressure
absolute pressure in the inlet manifold measured in inches of mercury
absolute pressure in the inlet manifold measured in millibars
inlet manifold pressure in pounds per square inch above or below atmospheric pressure

questions.question: “Full Throttle Height” is:

options.content: the height at which the engine is at Rated Boost
the maximum height at which a specified boost can be maintained at a specified rpm
the height at which the wastegate is fully closed
the cruising height for any specific boost

questions.question: The purpose of an intercooler is:

options.content: to minimize the risk of detonation
to increase the volume of the charg
to decrease the density of the charge
to prevent overheating of the exhaust manifold

questions.question: The function of a diffuser in a supercharger is:

options.content: to decrease the temperature and increase the velocity of the charge
to increase the velocity and decrease the pressure of the charge
to decrease the velocity and decrease the pressure of the charge
to decrease the velocity and increase the pressure of the charge

questions.question: Air enters the compressor of a turbosupercharger:

options.content: at the tip and passes across the impeller blades to exit at the eye
at the diffuser and exits at the impeller
at the eye and passes across the diffuser blades before exiting at the impeller tip
at the eye and passes across the impeller blades to exit at the tip

questions.question: The wastegate of a turbosupercharger is fitted:
The wastegate is operated by:
With a turbocharger installed on the engine, its exhaust back pressure:
A high performance supercharger may require an intercooler to be placed:

options.content: between the supercharger and the inlet valve
between the engine block and the exhaust manifold

questions.question: With an increase of compressor discharge pressure the fuel flow will:

options.content: increase, but only in proportion to altitude increase

questions.question: A turbochargerˊs rotational speed is determined by:

options.content: the position of the throttle valve
the density of the air at the compressor intake

questions.question: During take-off from a sea level airfield with ISA conditions, the position of the wastegate of a turbocharged engine is:
Maximum Continuous Power (MCP) is:

options.content: unrestricted, but only if economical cruising power is s
the maximum power the engine will give at any time

questions.question: The primary purpose of a supercharger is to:

options.content: raise the temperature of the charge entering the cylinder
increase the mass of the charge entering the cylinder
improve the engineˊs exhaust scavenging capability, and hence increase its power output
allow the use of high octane fuel

questions.question: The type of fuel used in a turbocharged engine would be:
At an idle or low power condition, the turbocharger wastegate is normally:
When the air or the mixture passes through the diffuser shroud, the energy conversion is from:
The construction of a turbocharger ensures that the turbine and the compressor:
The wastegate fitted to a turbocharger regulates the quantity of:

options.content: the mixture that enters the induction manifold
the atmosphere that can enter the compressor
the exhaust gas that will bypass the turbine
the exhaust gas that leaves the compressor

questions.question: The main function of a supercharger is to:

options.content: increase the thermal efficiency of the engine
increase the compression ratio of the engine
maintain sea level pressure in the engine to above rated altitude
increase the volumetric efficiency of the engine

questions.question: The response of a turbocharged engine to rapid throttle opening, when compared to a normally aspirated engine:

options.content: is initially better, but exhaust back pressure will cause a flat spot

questions.question: With a constant manifold pressure set during the climb, the power output from an internally supercharged engine:
An internal supercharger is one which:
If the wastegate of a turbocharged engine seizes in the climb before critical altitude has been reached:

options.content: engine power will be automatically adjusted by the ABC
engine power will rise by approximately 10%
reducing back pressure will compensate for any loss in power
engine power will fall as the climb continues

questions.question: To prevent large acceleration loads on the compressor and the drive shaft of an internal supercharger, it is usual to:

options.content: incorporate a spring drive mechanism in the driving gears
rely on the inertia absorbing qualities of the exhaust gases

questions.question: The rotational speed of the turbocharger of an engine which is at full throttle at low altitude is:
Maintaining a constant manifold pressure in a turbocharged engine during the climb will cause:

options.content: the exhaust gas temperature to decrease due to a decrease in exhaust back pressure
the diffuser rotational speed to increase

questions.question: Overboosting an engine fitted with a turbocharger is prevented by the installation of:
A turbocharger which is designed to maintain sea level pressure at altitude is termed:
With the power lever opened for take-off power at sea level, the throttle butterfly of an engine fitted with an internal supercharger would be:
“Static Boost” is the manifold pressure indicated on the boost pressure gauge when:

options.content: the engine is running at the manufacturerˊs recommended idle speed
the engine is running at its rated power
the manifold gauge needle is opposite the lubber line

questions.question: The limit of the amount of supercharging that an engine can tolerate is reached when:

options.content: the engine is at its rated altitude
the engine starts to suffer from detonation

questions.question: The rotational speed of a turbocharger is dependent upon:
The inlet manifold pressure of a turbocharged engine in an aircraft which is climbing will:

options.content: increase to full throttle height and then fall
increase to critical height and then remain constant
remain constant to critical altitude and then fall
decrease to critical altitude and then remain constant

questions.question: The type of compressor normally used in a supercharger is:
The compressor output pressure of an internal supercharger is:

options.content: sometimes greater, sometimes less than the manifold pressure

questions.question: The position of the wastegate in a turbocharged engine is:
The maximum engine brake horsepower with a specified rpm and manifold pressure set which permits continuous safe operation is termed:
The compressor output of a turbocharger unit is:

options.content: the same as the manifold pressure
sometimes greater, sometimes less than the manifold pressure

questions.question: Within the compressor of a turbocharger:

options.content: the pressure increases and the temperature decreases
both the pressure and the temperature increase
both the pressure and the temperature decrease
the pressure increases and the temperature remains constant

questions.question: The type of compressor normally fitted to turbochargers and superchargers would compress the air:
If the wastegate of a turbocharged engine seizes during the climb, the manifold pressure will:
To maintain the Rated Boost of a supercharged engine while reducing the rpm:

options.content: the throttle valve must be opened
the throttle valve must be closed

questions.question: The effect of selecting Rated Boost, but less than Rated rpm on the climb, would be that:

options.content: the Rated Altitude would be lower
the Full Throttle Height would be less
the Rated Altitude would be higher
the Full Throttle Height would be higher

questions.question: The Automatic Boost Control Unit operates

options.content: the rpm gauge and the manifold pressure gauge

questions.question: Boost pressure is indicated on:

options.content: the rpm gauge and the manifold pressure gauge

questions.question: With an increase of compressor discharge pressure, the fuel flow will:
Superchargers are used to overcome:

options.content: the decrease in density due to the increase in altitude
the increase in temperature due to the increase in altitude
the fuel density variation that occurs with an increase in altitude

questions.question: The boost pressure of a turbocharged engine is controlled by:

options.content: varying the speed of the turbocharger

questions.question: In a supercharger, the mixture:

options.content: enters through the eye of the impeller and leaves at the periphery
enters at the periphery and leaves through the eye
enters through the turbine and leaves through the compressor
enters through the compressor and leaves through the turbine
